info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:59PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT DAVIE...EAST CENTRAL IREDELL AND NORTHWESTERN ROWAN COUNTIES THROUGH 645 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles east of Statesville, or near Cleveland, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mocksville, Statesville, Salisbury, Bermuda Run, Cooleemee, Cleveland, Fork Church, Advance, Mount Ulla, and Piedmont Research Station. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
